elements.title: Johnson beat Jeffries (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The New York Times claimed that if Johnson beat Jeffries (fight pictured), black people would "misinterpret his victory as justifying claims to much more than mere physical equality with their white neighbors"?

elements.title: Church of St Benedict (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Grade II*–listed Church of St Benedict, in Ardwick, Manchester, is now a climbing centre?

elements.title: Sarah Aristidou (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2021 Sarah Aristidou recorded Jörg Widmann's Labyrinth V, a wordless piece for her soprano voice with "ululations, sobs, jazz inflections and wild laughter"?

elements.title: Windows 3.1 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Windows 3.1 had a special version, known as Modular Windows, that was controlled via television?

elements.title: Robert Bauer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the 1960s and 1970s, American artist Robert Bauer painted figures that were a mixture of 20th-century avant-garde funk and 17th-century Dutch realism?

elements.title: a Catholic radio station in Texas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Catholic radio station in Texas airs religious talk shows, the Mass—and weekly broadcasts of high school football?

elements.title: Jonathan Beaulieu-Richard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jonathan Beaulieu-Richard retired from the Canadian Football League to become a pharmacist?

elements.title: Seven Days (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1979 the magazine Seven Days advised, to avoid ingesting plutonium orally, "never make an A-bomb on an empty stomach"?
